Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Luis Gonzalez-Pizarro held on 12/17/2007. Present were AUSA Andrew Massucco and AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Irma Valldejuli (substituting for counsel Mariangela Tirado). The Government proffered as to the role and participation of the defendant and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel proffered that the grandmother and sister of the defendant are willing to post their houses for bail purposes. Defendant can continue studying to obtain a high school diploma and is willing to wear an electronic monitoring device. After hearing the parties, the Court will take the matter UNDER ADVISEMENT. If released, defendant would have to reside outside the metropolitan area, a suitable third party custodian will be required, standard release conditions and urinalysis testing. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Hilda Gutierrez, PO: Evelyn Jimenez) (br) (Entered: 12/19/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Ramon Lanza-Vazquez (22) held on 12/17/2007. Present were AUSA Andrew Massucco, AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Hector Deliz. The Government proffered the role and participation of the defendant in the case and recommended defendant to be detained without bail. Defense counsel was heard by proffer and informed that the mother of defendant has a property to offer as bail. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $75,000 cash or secured by property. Standard release conditions imposed and urinalysis. Defendant shall not enter the Jardines de Selles Public Housing Project. The Government will reserve the right to appeal. (Court Reporter FTR/er, CD: Elba Rivas, CI: Edna Brayfield, PO: Evelyn Jimenez). (Court Reporter FTR.) (er) (Entered: 12/21/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas ‘Detention Hearing as to Victor Gonzalez-Vasquez (36) held on 12/17/2007. Present were AUSA Andrew G. Massucco, AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Francisco Diez. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Miguel Canales-Collazo (59) held on 12/17/2007. Present were AUSA Andrew Massucco, Olga Castellon and defense counsel Carlos Beck. Defense counsel informed that the mother in law of defendant has offered her house as to bail. The Government was heard by proffer and requested defendant to be detained without bail and believes to be a risk of flight and a danger to the community. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Rafael Fernandez-Texidor (68) held on 12/17/2007. Present were AUSA Andrew Massucco, Olga Castellon and defense counsel David Roman. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Detention Hearing as to Jose Carrasquillo-Gonzalez held on 12/19/2007. Defense proffered that the defendant has a learning disability and may live with mother or common law wife at another address and be allowed to pursue a drug treatment program. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Appearing for the Government Olga Castellon and Andrew Massucco and for defendant, Carlos Sanchez-La Costa. Defendant is present in Court.Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Evelyn Martinez (64) Count 1,2-5,8 held on 12/28/2007. The Court states to the Government that the indictment should be amended to correct defendant's name, as it appears in the indictment as Evelyn Martinez, when the correct name is Evelyn Bayala- Martinez. Defense counsel is heard as to bail and states that defendant is not a risk of flight, has no criminal record and no criminal history. He further states that defendant has strong ties to the community. Defendant's sister is present in Court, but has no assets. Counsel for the Government is heard and requests that defendant be detained and if bail is imposed, the same should be in the amount of $50,000.00 cash or secured. The Court after hearing counsel states that it will adopt the Pretrial Report and bail is set in the amount of $25,000.00 of which $10,000.00 shall be secured property and $15,000.00 unsecured, electronic monitoring and home detention. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 01/02/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas :Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Kevin Aviles-Rivera (43), held on 12/28/07. After hearing the parties, the Court asked defense counsel to speak with the MDC Ward regarding his client medical condition, and as to bail the Court finds defendant is a risk of flight and ordered defendant to be detained without bail, pending trial. ORDER re 482 MOTION for DeNovo Hearing and Stay of Magistrate's Order to Release Defendant on Bond to an In-Patient Care Facility, as to Jose Osorio-Ortiz(26) . The offenses charged trigger statutory presumptions of flight risk and danger. The presumption of flight has been rebutted by defendant's actions and compliance with bail conditions within 07-233 (GAG). No specific showing is made concerning "danger to community" except bold allegation defendnat has been "implicated" as a triggerman. The request for stay is Denied. Were the government in a position to make a specific showing of evidence, it shall move for reconsideration of this Order. Signed by Judge Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 1/14/2008.(wm) Modified on 1/16/2008 to add defendant's name (cm). (Entered: 01/15/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government in the morning, Maritza Maldonado. Defendant is present in Court. Defense counsel is not present in Court. The Court wants the minutes to reflect that defense counsel filed yesterday a motion after 5:00 P.M., and this motion has been untimely filed. The Court sees no excuse for requesting a continuance so late, since typically, jury selections which counsel is presently selecting the same are scheduled way in advanced. Counsel shall file on future occasions this type of motion on a timely manner. This hearing is rescheduled for today at 4:00 PM. Thereafter, at 4:00 PM, the Court reconvenes and defense counsel, Laura Maldonado, present in Court, explains to the Court the reasons why she filed the motion yesterday after 5:00 PM. and also states certain thing that were not said in said motion The Court after hearing counsel states that she should file on future occasions this type of motion on a timely matter.Arraignment and Detention Hearing held as to Lerman Sevilla-Berrios (12) Count 1,2-5,6,8 held on 2/1/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty entered as to all counts. Defense counsel is granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to Detention, defense counsel is heard and states that defendant's family is indigent and don't have money to post. She further requests that defendant be release to house arrest or be sent to a drug treatment program. Counsel for the Govenment, in the afternoon present, Olga Castellon and Andrew Massucco are heard. The Court after hearing arguments by counsel and after taking into account the pretrial report, finds that defendant is a risk of flight and a danger to the community and orders that defendant be detain pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 02/01/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Andrew Massucco and for defendant, Jose R. Aguayo. Defendant is present in Court. Defense counsel informs the Court that he has been directly appointed to represent this defendant and he represents defendant #35, Carlos Santiago in this case. The Court states that a Foster Hearing will be scheduled.Arraignment and bail hearing as to John Doe #3 (99) Count 1,2-5,8 held on 3/4/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment and enters a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Defendant is granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. The case is to be referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel states that defendant was born and raised in P.R., has no passport, has not traveled. Defendant has 2 children and is further heard as to two prior records, etc. Counsel for the Government is heard and first of all requests that the indictment be amended to reflect that defendant's true name is DANIEL L. ARZUAGA-RIVERA, WHIC IS GRANTED BY THE COURT. THE CAPTION OF INDICTMENT SHOULD BE AMENDED TO REFLECT THE CORRECT NAME. Counsel is also heard as to bail and as to the pretrial recommendation, which counsel objects and is heard. He further states that if the court is going to give bail that the same be in the amount of $50,000.00. The Court after hearing counsel sets bail in the amount of $50,000.00 cash or secured. All standard conditions shall apply. Randum drug testing, if substance abuse treatment is needed, the pretrial is withing the discretion to do so. Defendant is to fully comply with all conditions of release. Foster Hearing set for 3/12/2008 09:15 AM before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 03/05/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Foster Hearing as to Gustavo Burgos-Rivera, Elvin Santos-Melendez held on 4/16/2008. Present were AUSA G.A. Massucco, Mr. Juan Nieves-Cassas and court interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. Mr. Nieves-Cassas addressed the Court informing that there had been a mix-up on his part and he had thought that co-defendant Rivera-Burgos was not his defendant, but that after having spoken with him today in Court, defendant had agreed to continue being represented by him. Acknowledgments of joint representation were filed by both defendants. The Court advised them of the possible conflict which may arise. Both defendants acknowledged having been explained in Spanish by Mr. Nieves and that both agreed to him representing them. AUSA Massucco stated that the Government had no objection to Mr. Nieves-Cassas representing both defendants. Forms were approved by the Court as well as the legal representation. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 04/16/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Andrew Massucco and for defendants, Thomas Lincoln. Both defendants are present in Court.Foster Hearing as to Antonio Perez-Medina, Luis Delgado-Rodriguez held on 4/21/2008. Defense counsel informs the Court that he met separately with each defendant and thereafter with both defendants and went over the acknowledgment of joint representation. He further states that he spoke to AUSA Massucco and stated that there could be a conflict and is heard. Counsel for the Government, Massucco is also heard and states that both defendants were runners at the  same drug point and in the same project, that is Jardines Selles. He further states that he believes that both defendants know each other, to which Counsel Lincoln states that after speaking to both defendant and after both defendants saw each other, they both stated that they knew each other. Further arguments by both counsel are heard. The Court after hearing counsel and after evaluating this issue, states that it WILL NOT GRANT THE JOINT REPRESENTATION and orders that defendant #15, Antonio Perez-Medina, shall remain with CJA counsel Thomas Lincoln and as to defendant #38, Luis Delgado-Rodriguez, a new cja attorney be appointed. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 04/22/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas as to Jose Sterling-Cosme held on 05/30/2008. Present were SAUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Vladimir Mihailovich. Defendant is present in Court and under custody. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. PONG is entered as to the above counts.Defense is granted 5 days to meet with the US Attorney to obtain discovery and 10 days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to Detention, defense counsel requested some time to speak with the parents of defendant regarding bail. The Government requested detention without bail, due to prior convictions, risk of flight and the use of controlled substances. Defense counsel rebutted the prior convictions were years ago and defendant was receiving treatment for the use of controlled substances and had a job. The Court granted the rescheduling of the Detention Hearing. (PTO Charlotte Agostini, CI Janis Palma, CD Elba Rivas) Detention Hearing reset for 6/3/2008 09:00 AM in Courtroom 8 before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas. (Court Reporter FTR.) (er) Modified on 6/3/2008 (ab). (Entered: 06/02/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Olga Castellon and for both defendants, Raymond Sanchez-Maceira. Both defendant are present in court and are (U/C).Conflict of Interest Hearing as to Hector Delgado-Diaz, Luis Rosario-Velez held on 9/25/2008. Both defendants are duly worn in and are admonished by the Magistrate of the possibility of a conflict of interest as a result of the joint representation. Counsel for defendant states that so far he does not foresee a conflict. Counsel for the Government is heard. Both defendants waived their rights to be represented by separate counsel. The Court after hearing counsel and after making inquiries to both defendants, finds that defendants are acting voluntarily and the joint representation forms are accepted. The forms are to be filed and made part of the record. Defendants were advised that if a conflict should arise, they are to inform the Court and new counsel will be appointed if they do not have the sources to retain counsel. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Hilda  Gutierrez. )Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 03:04.Hearing ended at 03:29. (mn) (Entered: 09/29/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: DeNovo Hearing as to Geovany Contreras-Santiago held on 10/8/2008. Parties proceed by proffer. Government requests detention. Defense moves that bail be set. Defendant's mother is present, can be his third party custodian and relatives can post a $20,000 secured bond. After hearing the parties, the Court sets bail as follows: Bond set as to Geovany Contreras-Santiago (101) 50,000 cash or secured. Third party custodian to be qualified by USPO. EMD to be set before defendant's release, home incarceration until defendant's employment is confirmed. Defendant must relocate and cannot go back to Jardines de Selles Housing Project, cannot meet with people charged or convicted or contact co-defendants in the case, unless accompanied by counsel. No passport, no travel, urinalysis. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Janis Palma.)Hearing set for 12:00 p.m. Hearing held at 12:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 12:48 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA G. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Jose Garcia-Feliciano (45) held on 1/27/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty is entered as to Counts 1s-5s, 8s. Case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado-Colon for trial setting. Arguments heard as to detention. The Court granted the government's request and ordered that the defendant remain detained pending trial. Defense counsel informs the Court that he also represents defendant (107) Jose Sterling-Cosme in this case, that this defendant is currently a fugitive, and that he has explained a possible conflict of interest to defendant Garcia-Feliciano. The government adds that charges for both defendants arise from events that occurred in the same public housing project, that at this time and considering the fugitive status of defendant (107) they do not foresee a problem, but that the issue will have to be revisited if defendant (107) is arrested and the case goes to trial. Upon questioning by the Court, the defendant agrees to the joint representation. The Court will allow the joint representation. The matter will be revisited and a foster hearing will be held if and once defendant (107) is arrested. Defendant is advised that he may request other representation at any time if he does not wish to be represented by the same counsel appointed to another co-defendant. Defense counsel is reminded of his obligation to inform the Court of any possible conflicts of interest. (SAUSA Olga Castellon. Atty Vladimir Mihailovich. PO Evelyn Jimenez. CR FTR. CI Tom Kavelin.) (Hearing set for 9:00, held at 9:18, ended at 9:28.) (jm) (Entered: 01/27/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Ilianys Rivera and for defendant, Jessica Torres-Vinals. PTO-Patricia Encarnacion. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Arraignment and  Detention Hearing as to Edwin Rosario-Alvarez (25) Count 1,1s,2-5,2s-4s,5s,6,6s,8,8s held on 2/2/2009. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel is heard and states that defendant was working in Orlando, Fl. without any knowledge that an indictment had been filed She further states that defendant does not present any risk of flight, no prior criminal record. Counsel for the Government objects and is heard. The Court after making inquiries and hearing both parties, sets bail as follows: Bail set int he amt. of $30,000.00 cash or secured. Home incarceration. Electronic monitoring. Defendant is not allowed to reside or enter El Prado Housing Project. Defendant cannot leave the jurisdicgion of Puerto Rico. Defendant shall participate in a program of substance therapy and counseling as determine by PTO, whether it should be impatient or outpatient. All other conditions of release shall be adopted. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Janis Palma.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:43.Hearing ended at 02:06. (mn) (Entered: 02/02/2009)

Both defendants are duly sworn in and are admonished by the Magistrate of the possibility of a conflict of interest as a result of the joint representation. Counsel for defendants states  that so far he does not foresee a conflict. Government's counsel is heard. Both defendants waived their rights to be represented by separate counsel. The Court finds that the defendants are acting voluntarily and the joint representation forms are accepted. The forms are to be filed and made part of the record. Defendants were advised that if a conflict arise, they are to inform the Court and new counsel will be appointed if they do not have the sources to retain counsel. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 09:15.Hearing held at 09:38.Hearing ended at 09:54. (mn) (Entered: 04/06/2009)

AUSA Andrew Massucco and defense counsel Jason Gonzalez were present and ready. Defendant was held at the USM cell block, but the US Marshals never showed up after waiting half hour. Defense counsel informed the Court that he had met with his client and explained the consequences that may occur at the hearing and will not contest the same. The Court ordered that counsel certify by telephone or in writing that counsel communicated with defendant and that he does not want to have a reconsideration. The Court revoked the bail and ordered defendant remanded. Defense counsel informs the Court that there's a discrepancy as to the plea agreement and 1s heard. The Change of Plea Hearing is hereby reset for 6/5/2009 02:30 PM before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Bail Review Hearing as to Rafael Moya-Colon held on 6/30/2009. Parties proceed by proffer. Arguments are heard on behalf of both parties. Upon conclusion of the same, the Court affirms the Magistrate Judge's order of detention for dangerousness. As to the flight risk presumption, based on the weight of the government's evidence (three video clips played), defendant is ordered to remain under custody. If deemed so necessary, the Court orders the transcript of the entire proceeding. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) (Court Interpreter Moises Hernandez.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:30 a.m. Hearing ended at 12:30 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSAs G. Andrew Massucco and Olga Castellon. Defense counsel Jorge Vega-Pacheco. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Charlette Agostini also present. (Entered: 07/01/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose Martin Serrano-Ayuso held on 9/8/2009. AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Linda Backiel were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Superseding Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under custody. A report and recommendation will be issued. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. Sentence will be set at a later date. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez.) (Court Interpreter Marie Hernandez.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 09:43. Hearing ended at 10:05. (br) (Entered: 09/08/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Cesar Rivera-Giraud, for defendant, Joseph Boucher & PTO, Patricia Encarnacion.Arraignment & Bail Hearing as to Juan Concepcion- Mercado (28) Count 1,1s,2-5,2s-4s,5s,6,6s,8,8s held on 12/14/2009. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts. The case is to be referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel gives a proffer to the Court and states that there's a property in Villa Palmeras worth $100,000.00 and requests the setting of conditions of release. Counsel for the Government objects and a proffer is given to the Court. Arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel makes ruling for the record and finds that defendant is a risk of flight and danger to the community and is to be detain pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Tom Kavelin.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:19.Hearing ended at 09:27. (mn) (Entered: 12/14/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were SAUSA Cesar Rivera, Mr. Juan Hernandez-Lopez de Victoria and PTO Patricia Encarnacion. Arraignment as to Mario L. Vazquez-Montalvo (111) Count 1,1s,2- 5,2s-4s,5s,8,8s held on 1/19/2010. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial scheduling. Mr. Hernandez requested that the detention hearing be continued so that PT and himself could contact defendant's family members and verify information. The Government did not oppose the continuance, but stated for the record that they have information that defendant knew of the indictment against him since the first day and had remained a fugitive for two years. The Court granted defense counsel's request and RESET the Detention Hearing for 1/29/2010 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:56.Hearing ended at 10:04. (yr) (Entered: 01/19/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Change of Plea Hearing as to Edwin Vazquez-Colon was called but not held on 2/24/2010. AUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Juan Milanes were present. Defendant was present and under custody. Defense counsel informed that defendant found out that a status conference has been set for tomorrow. Defendant has communicated that he does not wish to plea today until defendant finds out what the outcome of the conference was and if whether or not there might be any offers or plea agreement packages. Counsel reviewed the plea agreement with defendant and the government was advised that it 1s to the best interest of justice to the defendant. Defense counsel requested a continuance of the hearing. The Government stated that he does not foresee any change in the plea  agreement, but understands defendant's position and does not object to the continuance. The Court ordered that the motion for change of plea will remain in the record and that today's hearing for change of plea is vacated. Defense counsel shall file motion sometime next week with suggested rescheduling dates. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez.) (Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 10:13. Hearing ended at 10:17. (br) (Entered: 02/26/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Change of Plea Hearing as to Eduardo Berrios-Sepulveda held on 3/31/2010. AUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Juan E. Milanes were present. Atty Milanes requested to withdraw the change of plea motion. Defendant has chosen not to accept the plea agreement. The Court addressed defendant and is not willing to go to trial or plea. The Court advised defendant. If defendant does not plea today, the Government will withdraw the plea agreement and defendant will proceed to trial. Proposed trial date by Judge Delgado is for September or October, 2010. The Court granted additional time for defendant and counsel to continue discussing the plea agreement. After calling the case for the third time, the Court rescheduled the hearing for today, at 1:00 pm. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Superseding Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under custody. A report and recommendation will be issued. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. Sentence will be set at a later date.(Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez.) (Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing called at 9:45-9:46, 10:10-10:14 and 10:26-10:34.Hearing held at 01:15. Hearing ended at 01:47. (br) (Entered: 04/07/2010)
CONVICTION Notification for U.S. Probation Office as to Eduardo Berrios-Sepulveda (br) (Entered: 04/07/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Change of Plea Hearing as to Alberto Carrillo-Morales held on 4/28/2010. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he 1s facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the plea of not guilty is withdrawn and the plea of guilty as to Count One (1) of the superseding indictment is entered. The defendant is to remain under custody. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Pretrial Conference as to Edwin Rosario-Alvarez held on 9/10/2010. ORDER as to Rafael Galan-Olavarria re: 3352 MOTION for Reconsideration. Counsel characterizes the denial of his objections to the R&R as abrupt and argues he had petition for resolution in a respectful manner. The record of the status conference at which over 30 attorneys speak by itself. Counsel for defendant has received rulings to his petitions that he refuses to accept and continues to file motions dwelling on issues ruled upon. More so, while in court, continues to re-argue the same issues. It took him 3 years to file objections to the R&R because he wants the court to order disclosure of governments reports and Jencks at early stages. The time has now come for such disclosures. Meanwhile, a status conference has been set for counsel to raise any pending pre-trial issues. Nonetheless, counsel is warned that his abrupt interruption at conferences, and much less at the upcoming trial, will not be tolerated. Any pending concerns in regards to Docket No. 2286 (R&R) and Docket No. 2825 (Objections to) will be addressed at the 10/29/2010 status conference. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 10/27/2010.(wm) Modified on 10/27/2010 to add link (ov). (Entered: 10/27/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Rafael Moya-Colon held on 11/3/2010 re 3475 . Issues raised in motion filed by counsel are addressed. Upon inquiry of the Court, the defendant states that its his intent to enter a plea of guilty, however, he considers that contradictory information has been provided to him and therefore a final plea agreement has not been reached. Government's counsel clarifies that the plea offer was extended and due to particular circumstances, the offer was later withdrawn. However, can meet with counsel to disclose the name of the witness that will testify as to the defendant's role within the conspiracy and continue in plea negotiations. Court addresses the defendant, matter is taken care of. Attorney Jorge Vega remains as counsel for defendant. Jury Trial remains as set. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith.) Hearing set for 2:15 p.m. Hearing held at 3:25 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m. (sr) Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Jorge Vega-Pacheco. Defendant present and assisted by Court Interpreter. (Entered: 11/04/2010)

ORDER re 3587 Motion Requesting Order as to Rafael Galan-Olavarria (17). Request (a) is Noted and Denied. Request (b) - FR.Ev. 403 does not require of a geography balancing test. Not being part of the conspiracy, the only issue will be relevance, remoteness and whether prejudicial. While not to be brought in case in chief - may be used for impeachment purposes. Request (c)(d) - deadlines have been clearly set. Request (e) - Moot inasmuch as all Jencks has been provided and counsel has available mechanisms to obtain any other necessary records. Counsel was attempting to obtain as Jencks, reports from a supervising agent who did not testify, did not participate in the search. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 11/18/2010. (wm) (Entered: 11/22/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Arraignment/Detention as to Luis Jimenez-Rivera (7) Count 1s,2s-4s,5s,6s,8s held on 1/25/2011. AUSA-Mariana Bauza and attorney Eric Pijuan were present. Defendant waived reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered as to all counts. Defense is granted five (5) days to meet with the U. S. Attorney to obtain discovery and ten (10) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. Defense counsel moves for bail; stated that defendant lives in PR and has been living here with his wife for three years. Deft owns a house in Orlando, Fl and is self-employed. Govt brings to the Court's attention the fact that deft has been fugitive for three years. After taking into consideration statements by the parties, matter is taken under advisement. Deft to continue U/C. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:35.Hearing ended at 09:40. (ja) (Entered: 01/25/2011)

ORDER re 4114 Motion for Acquittal as to Luis R. Nieves-Canales (16). Defendant's pro-se motion is denied on multiple grounds: a) Ground#3-never materialized inasmuch as no such evidence was ever excluded. b) Ground #5-is already contradicted by the record. c) Ground #1-is not legally sound. Petite policy considerations and related issues raised were to be raised and disposed of during the pre-trial stages. None were ever raised. d) Ground #2 and #4 are considered meritless. e) Defendant remains assisted by counsel and shall refrain pro-se filings-absent exigent circumstances. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 2/22/2011. (wm) (Entered: 02/22/2011)

Transcript may be viewed at the court public terminal or purchased through the Court Reporter/Transcriber before the deadline for Release of Transcript Restriction. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Raul Mariani. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Charlette Agostini also present. Parties met in chambers to address concerns raised by defense counsel. Mr. Jose Cordero, Paralegal Specialist at MDC- Guaynabo was contacted and defendant will be properly credited for the time he has already served. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Requests a concurrent sentence be imposed. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1s, Term of imprisonment: One hundred and sixty-eight (168) months, as to Count One in each of the following cases: CR. 07-0547-36 and CR. 10-0444-022. SMA of $100 per count.; Count(s) 2s- 4s, 5s, 6s, 8s, Dismissed. The defense moves for reconsideration of the term imposed. Reconsideration is Denied. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 10/12/2011 for Ramon Lanza-Vazquez (22). Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and SAUSA Cesar Rivera. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Victor Carlo also present. PSR to be amended accordingly to the changes ordered by the Court. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1s, and 3s. Term of imprisonment: Two hundred and forty (240) months as to Counts 1 and 3, to be served concurrently with each other. SRT of ten (10) years as to each count, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count. As to Count(s) 8s, Forfeiture, the Court determines the following: Defendant shall satisfy any money judgment and/or shall forfeit to the US all property, real and/or personal titles and interests in such properties, constituting, commingled or derived from the proceeds he obtained directly or indirectly as the result of the criminal activity charged for which he's been convicted.. (Court Reporter Evilys E. Brathwaite.) Hearing set for 3:15 p.m. Hearing held at 4:10 p.m. Hearing ended at 6:10 p.m. Interpreter Annie Flores. (sr) (Entered: 10/14/2011)

JUDGMENT as to Ramon Lanza-Vazquez (22), Count(s) 1s and 3s. Term of imprisonment: Two hundred and forty (240) months as to Counts | and 3, to be served concurrently with each other. SRT of ten (10) years as to each count, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count.; Count(s) 8s, Forfeiture: Defendant shall satisfy any money judgment and/or shall forfeit to the US all property, real and/or personal titles and interests in such properties, constituting, commingled or derived from the proceeds he obtained directly or indirectly as the result of the criminal activity charged for which he's been convicted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 10/26/2011 for Alberto L. Gonzalez-Ortiz (47). Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel David Ramos-Pagan. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPOs Katherine Valentin and Charlette Agostini. Motions filed at DE 4344, 5061, 5065, 5068 are Noted. Court notes that based on the information (documents related to the state convictions) provided by the Government, the defendant is not a career offender. Therefore, he is a Criminal History Category of III. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1s, Term of imprisonment: One hundred and twenty (120) months. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00. Count(s) 2s-4s, 5s, 8s, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:30 p.m. Hearing held at 5:00 p.m. Hearing ended at 5:17 p.m. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. ORDER approving and adopting as to Alberto Carrillo-Morales (By Order of the Court) re 5298 Subsequent Motion re: Crack Cocaine Stipulation for Sentencing Reduction as to Alberto Carrillo-Morales Re: 5241 MOTION for Retroactive Application of Sentencing Guidelines to Crack Cocaine Offense 18 USC 3582Subsequent Motion re: Crack Cocaine Stipulation for Sentencing Reduction as to Alberto Carrillo-Morales Re: 5241 MOTION for Retroactive Application of Sentencing Guidelines to Crack Cocaine Offense 18 USC 3582 filed by Alberto Carrillo-Morales . By Order of the Court: In view of the stipulation entered into by the parties on May 26, 2012 (Docket No. 5298), the sentence of defendant Alberto Carrillo-Morales is modified in accordance with the provisions of U.S.S.G. Sec. 1B1.10(c) as amended and 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(2). Alberto Carrillo-Morales was sentenced on March 14, 2011 to 235 months of imprisonment. In view of the Court having approved the stipulation that a sentence of 188 months imprisonment is appropriate, and that no hearing is required to modify the sentence, the Clerk is directed to enter an amended judgment imposing a sentence of 188 months of imprisonment. The remainder of the defendant's judgment shall remain unchanged. Signed by U.S. Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas on 6/10/2012.(Arenas, Justo) (Entered: 06/10/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Hearing regarding revocation of conditions of supervised release as to Jonathan Rosario-Rivera not held on 7/2/2012. Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera and AFPD John Connors and defense counsel Jose Gaztambide, who represented defendant for plea and sentencing purposes. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Yarixa Vazquez also present. Defense informs that defendant is not contesting the allegations, as so informed by the USPO. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Sidebar Conference held. Court will hold in abeyance the Revocation Proceedings. Instead the Court will modify the conditions of supervised release as follows: defendant is to be remain at a halfway house for six (6) months and participate in a drug rehabilitation treatment program. Defendant strongly admonished that if he does not comply, he will be revoked. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Minute Order. for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Omar Alvarado-Alvarado held on 8/9/2013. Present in Court were: AUSA Victor Acevedo, AFPD Sulay Rios-Fuentes, USPO August Castro. Purported Witnesses did not appear in Court today, despite subpoena. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll:  Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Orlando Nieves-Velez (90) held on 3/5/2015. AUSA Carlos Cardona and AFPD Victor Gonzalez were present. Defense counsel does not contest that defendant tested positive for marihuana, but denying the brandishing of a firearm. All the cases at state level in New Jersey were dismissed. The Government requested that, since defendant is not denying one of the alleged violations, the Court find probable cause and the case bound to the district judge for a final revocation hearing. The Court did not make any findings as to the new allegations stated in DE # 5291 . Guillermo Montanez. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:22. Hearing ended at 09:25. Minute entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Daniel L. Arzuaga-Rivera (99) held on 4/17/2015. Present: AUSA Julia Meconiates and Defense Counsel Hector Ramos-Vega. Defendant is present and under custody. Preliminary Examination is not held since defendant filed a waiver. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause. The defendant is held to answer to a Grand Jury of this District. The matter is referred to Judge Delgado- Colon for final revocation hearing. The Government requests the defendant remain detained. Defense Counsel argues in favor of release. The Court orders defendant be released under the same conditions previously imposed for supervised release, adding home detention with electronic monitoring. Probation will coordinate this as defendant has an electronic monitoring device from the local authorities. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Court Interpreter Janis Palma.) (USPO Alejandro Martinez.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Daniel L. Arzuaga-Rivera (99) held on 7/13/2015. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez and AFPD Hector Ramos. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Angel Meaux also present. Sidebar Conference held. Government proceeds by proffer (witnesses USPO Angel Meaux and Ruth Nilsie Rivera-Mendez are present). Surveillance video is played and USPO Meaux, the supervising officer of the defendant addresses the Court. AFPD Ramos informs that his client does not contest failing to report his new arrest. As to the new criminal offense, that matter is pending trial at state level. The Court revoked the SRT imposed on 9/16/2010. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Government requests a term of imprisonment be imposed. Defendant's allocution heard. Defendant is revoked and to serve an imprisonment term of 14 months and SRT of 3 years. Defendant is remanded and US Marshals to note that he is pending state trial and is to be made available to state authorities, once state trial is reset. It's noted that AUSA Lopez stated he will notify state prosecutor. At the request of the defense, Court notes that following the instructions of AFPD Ramos, defendant appeared in federal court for his revocation hearing. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:58 a.m. Hearing ended at 12:45 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sr) (Entered: 07/13/2015)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Daniel L. Arzuaga-Rivera (99). Fourteen (14) months and SRT of three (3) years. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 7/13/2015.(sr) (Entered: 07/13/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos A. Bonano-Ortiz (84) held on 8/26/2015. Present were: AUSA Carlos Cardona for AUSA Lopez, AFPD Hector Ramos and USPO Luis Encarnacion. Defendant present O/B and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel informed that defendant will not contest the allegations of the motion filed by U.S. Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. Defendant's allocution was heard. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. The Court will not revoke the supervised release term at this time. Instead, a stern warning is given. Defendant shall continue under the same conditions of supervised release imposed 11/2/2012, in addition defendant shall participate in outpatient drug treatment program and shall perform 10 hours per month of community service (if not employed). (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 01:00. Hearing held at 01:40. Hearing ended at 01:50. Interpreter Moises Hernandez. (amr) (Entered: 08/31/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Luis Gutierrez-Navedo (117) held on 11/18/2015. Present: AUSA Edward Veronda and AFPD Victor Gonzalez. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Counsel for defendant informs his client accepts the violation regarding non compliance with drug testing and/treatment and not notifying change of address. USPO Shakira Botello addresses the Court and makes a proffer of the conditions that defendant has violated. AFPD Gonzalez requests the USPO's chronological notes and informs that his client, who is presently at MDC-Guaynabo, is not receiving treatment for his medical condition. Court first reviews the chronological notes before they are shared with counsel. Defendant's allocution heard. SRT imposed on 3/23/2011 is hereby revoked. IMPR: ten (10) months. SRT of 48 months. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:50 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:45 p.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 11/26/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Motion Hearing as to Mariano Santana-Rodriguez (113) held on 7/6/2016 re 6410 INFORMATIVE Motion regarding medical treatment MOTION Requesting Order. Present were AUSA Cesar Rivera, defense counsel Vivian Torralbas and USPO Norman Rosario. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The issues brought forth in the aforementioned motion were discussed. The Court addressed the defendant regarding his willingness to participate in the Hogar Crea program. USPO Rosario informed the Court that the program was still available and he reiterated his recommendation that the defendant should participate in this program to deal with his substance abuse problem. Upon the verbal referral of the presiding judge and after hearing the parties, the Court ordered that the defendant be transported directly  from the courthouse to the Hogar Crea Center. The Court also imposed the following conditions of release pending the Final Revocation Hearing: in addition to participating in Hogar Crea's inpatient program, the defendant shall receive medical evaluation and treatment for substance abuse as recommended by USPO and he shall submit to drug testing. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 2:31 pm. Hearing ended at 2:44 pm. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (cmd) (Entered: 07/07/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Joseph Rosario-Rivera (58) held on 7/28/2016. Present: AUYSA Edward Veronda and AFPD Sulay Rios. Defendant is present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Luis Santana also present. Court met with the USPO and the defendant has repeatedly not complied with the rehabilitation treatment program and even failed to work food stand that was made available to him by the USPO. Counsel for defendant is aware of her client's poor adjustment, requests a term of imprisonment within the middle range of the applicable guideline and no further SRT be imposed. Government moves for an imprisonment term at the higher end of the guidelines. After hearing the parties, the SRT imposed on 5/20/2015 is revoked. IMPR of ten (10) months and SRT of three (3) years. Same conditions of original SRT shall remain in effect and defendant must have made arrangements to relocate before his release. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 11:30 a.m. Hearing called at 11:25 a.m. Hearing ended at 12:05 p.m. Interpreter Heidi Cazes. (sr) (Entered: 08/02/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Hearing on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Eduardo Berrios-Sepulveda held on February 20, 2018. Present were AUSA Susan Zetta Jorgensen, and AFPD Vivian I. Torralbas- Halais. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as stated in the motions filed by the U.S. Probation Office at docket no. 6483. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. Time served requested. No objection by the United States as to a term of time served. The Court after having heard the parties, made a ruling that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release, and hence term imposed on July 6, 2016 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to time served with a Supervised Release term of Seventy (70) months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:39. Hearing ended at 11:01.Interpreter Annie Flores. USPO Camille Machado- Miranda. (om) (Entered: 02/20/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Angel Vicenty-Rolon (70) held on 8/20/2019. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and AFPD Alejandra Bird. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Angelica Rodriguez and Martin De Santiago also present. Counsel for defendant informed defendant will not contest the Grade B Violation. Court noted that revocation proceedings are as to a simple possession. Court reviewed the inventory of seized property provided by the USPO. Counsel for defendant reviewed the same as well, however, proffered that the defendant  does not accept he was in possession of the seized items. Government proffered that the preliminary revocation hearing, before the Magistrate Judge was waived and that the defendant is pending trial at state level which is set to commence on 8/28/2019. As to the availability of Government witnesses, he will verify their availability. Court noted Government to inform the Courtroom Deputy if witnesses are available to continue with revocation proceedings in the afternoon session. It is noted that Government's counsel informed agents will be unavailable this afternoon, can have them available next week. Therefore, Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release is set to continue on 8/27/2019 at 2:30 PM in Courtroom 1 before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Angel Vicenty-Rolon (70) held on 8/27/2019. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera, AFPD Alejandra Bird and USPO Angelica Rodriguez. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The Government's witnesses, PRPD Agents Abimael Colon and Eduardo Rivera, were also present in the courtroom. AUSA Rivera made a proffer of the testimony of the agents. AFPD Bird objected to a decision made by proffer. She argued that it was not necessary to listen to the agents’ testimony as she believed the Court had enough information to make a determination. The defense accepted that with the evidence available and the witnesses in court, the Government would have been able to carry the burden to establish a Grade B violation. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. The Government's statements were also heard. After having heard the parties, the Court imposed sentence as follows: IMPR: Ten (10) months. SRT: Seven (7) years. The time already served is to be credited toward the sentence imposed. All other terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 03:35.Hearing ended at 04:23 .Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (lod) (Entered: 09/07/2019)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Angel Vicenty-Rolon (70): IMPR: Ten (10) months. SRT: Seven (7) years. The time already served by the defendant is to be credited toward the sentence imposed. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 8/27/2019.(lod) (Entered: 09/07/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose F. Ramos- Arroyo (72) held on 7/17/2020. Present: AUSA Marc Chattah, AFPD Joseph Niskar and USPO Luis Santana. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceeding by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violation alleged in the Motion filed by USPO at Docket No. 6839 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. As the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel, the Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. AFPD Niskar argued for bail conditions pending the Final Revocation Hearing. The Government objected and requested detention. USPO Santana's statements were also heard. After having heard the parties, the Court imposed conditions of release as follows: bond set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured, home detention with EMD, curfew from 7:00 PM - 7:00 AM, mental health treatment, domestic violence program, employment/education, drug testing (and treatment if necessary), plus standard conditions. The defendant shall live at his father's residence in Aibonito, PR. The defendant shall have no contact with Xiomara Mercado. Immediately upon release on 7/20/2020, the defendant shall report to the USPO to have his EMD installed. No Preliminary Revocation Hearing shall be held since the defendant will not remain under custody. Case is referred to U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for final hearing. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 09:58.Hearing ended at 10:54.Interpreter Sylvia Zetterstrand. (lod) (Entered: 07/23/2020)

2 1/2020 6968 Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose F. Ramos-Arroyo held on 9/21/2020. Present: SAUSA Yanira Colon and AFPD Carlos Vazquez. Defendant under SRT and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Luis Santana also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Counsel for defendant informed they will not contest the violations, as so informed by the Supervising US Probation Officer.  Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Requested matter be held in abeyance for a year (considering state sentence). If revoked, that he be revoked to a term of time served, concurrent with the state sentence. Government requested SRT be revoked and that an imprisonment term at the lower end of the applicable guideline be considered. Defendant's allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court will hold in abeyance the revocation proceedings and will reset the matter to be held in a year. Separate Order shall be issued with new setting for September, 2021. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 1:35 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:00 p.m. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (sr) (Entered: 09/21/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez: Second Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Edwin Vazquez-Colon (56) held on 3/1/2021. Present: AUSA Jeanette Collazo, AFPD Victor Chico, and USPO Ivelisse Alonso. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given  the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant consented to proceed by VTC, and has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record. The interpreter assisted the defendant on a secured line, as well, at Bayamon 705 and we had a clear view of him on screen. The Government stood by the recommendations made in its revocation memorandum, that is, 18 months of imprisonment to run consecutive with the sentence imposed in 19-323(PAD). Defense counsel stood by their revocation memorandum, as well, and requested a term of imprisonment within the lower end of the applicable guideline range, that is 12 months, to run concurrently with the sentence imposed in 19-323(PAD). The Government objected the request for concurrency in the imprisonment terms. Further, defense counsel requested no supervised release term be imposed as to revocation, in as much as a supervision term of three years was imposed in 19-323(PAD). The Government did not object. Allocution heard. After having heard the parties, the Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, supervised release term was REVOKED. Sentence imposed - IMPR: Eighteen (18) months, to be served consecutively to the sentence imposed on Case 3:19-CR-323-01 (PAD). No supervision to follow. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 10:30. Hearing held at 11:00. Hearing ended at 11:25. Interpreter Carlos T. Ravelo. (vso) (Entered: 03/01/2021)

SECOND JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Edwin Vazquez-Colon (56), IMPR: Eighteen (18) months, to be served consecutively to the sentence imposed on Case 3:19- CR-323-01 (PAD); No Supervision to follow. Signed by Judge Pedro A. Delgado- Hernandez on 3/1/2021. (vso) (Entered: 03/01/2021)
